definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Drunk will feed a small sugar taro, sprinkle with laurel pulp, beauty is not to say.
sentences.chinese: 酒后必食一小糖芋头，浇以桂浆，美不待言。

sentences.english: Allover taro top print celebrates the origin of the word "luau."
sentences.chinese: 全面性芋头顶部打印庆祝“卢奥一词的由来。”

sentences.english: My favorite is the taro stem and duck.
sentences.chinese: 而我最喜欢的就是秘制芋头茎酿鸭肉。

sentences.english: Your taro has been pulled up by someone.
sentences.chinese: 你们的芋头被人拔掉了。

sentences.english: Taro (Colocasia esculenta L. Schott), a tropical edible crop, contains an irritant factor in corm.
sentences.chinese: 芋头是热带性可食用作物，球茎含有刺激因子。

sentences.english: This year, we used the purplish tuber in taro and pumpkin tofu puffs.
sentences.chinese: 这年，我们用紫色块茎中的芋头，南瓜豆腐泡。

sentences.english: The freezing-law and quick-frozen technology of taros were studied in this thesis.
sentences.chinese: 对芋头的冻结规律与速冻工艺进行了研究。

sentences.english: Taro is a tropical plant used widely in the Pacific Islands.
sentences.chinese: 芋头是太平洋群岛普遍食用的热带植物。

sentences.english: The crispy and slightly sour preserved taro stem offsets the greasiness of the duck.
sentences.chinese: 那松脆和微酸的腌制芋头茎弥补了鸭的油腻。

sentences.english: Dice the taro and steam for about 20 minutes until cooked.
sentences.chinese: 芋头切成小粒，入蒸锅蒸20分钟至熟。

sentences.english: After the tests, the dregs of taros power never found.
sentences.chinese: 经过测试之后，均无发现有芋头粉块之残留现象。

definition: Chinese water chestnut/Eleocharis dulcis or E. congesta
nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
